# Lokus - Personal Knowledge Management App

> Lokus is a free, open-source, local-first personal knowledge management (PKM) application for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It helps users build a second brain with markdown notes, wiki links, graph views, and infinite canvas.

## What is Lokus?

Lokus is a **free and open-source PKM (Personal Knowledge Management) app** that stores all your notes locally on your device. Unlike cloud-based alternatives, Lokus ensures complete privacy - your data never leaves your computer.

### Key Features

- **Local-First Architecture**: All notes stored as markdown files on your device
- **Rich Markdown Editor**: Full markdown support with live preview
- **Wiki Links & Backlinks**: Connect ideas with [[wiki links]] and see all backlinks
- **Graph View**: Visualize connections between notes in 2D and 3D
- **Infinite Canvas**: Unlimited whiteboard for visual thinking
- **Template System**: 90+ template features with variables, conditionals, loops
- **Plugin Marketplace**: Extend functionality with community plugins
- **Theme System**: Customizable themes with live editor
- **100% Offline**: Works without internet connection
- **Cross-Platform**: Available for macOS, Windows, and Linux

### Comparison with Other PKM Apps

**Lokus vs Obsidian**: Both are markdown-based and local-first. Lokus is fully open-source and free forever, while Obsidian has paid sync and publish features.

**Lokus vs Notion**: Notion is cloud-based with collaboration features. Lokus is local-first with complete privacy and offline support.

**Lokus vs Logseq**: Both are open-source. Lokus uses traditional markdown files while Logseq uses an outliner approach.

**Lokus vs Roam Research**: Roam is cloud-based and subscription-based. Lokus is free, open-source, and local-first.

### Use Cases

- Personal knowledge management and second brain
- Academic research and note-taking
- Writing and content creation
- Project planning and documentation
- Zettelkasten method implementation
- Daily journaling with templates
